section.name: Poll Parameters
section.p: The parameters of the poll plug-in are implemented in the PollProvider delegate class. As long as custom components delegate to the PollProvider, they will "inherit" the set of parameters described here.

td.p: This parameter specifies a repository content path, relative to the site's root node, where the poll component should look for active poll documents represented by content beans of class poll-docsClass. The path should start with a forward slash ("/"), and should be considered mandatory.
If multiple matching and active poll documents are found under the specified path, the "first" one will be processed.

tr.td: This parameter specifies the class of the content beans that contain poll documents to be processed by this instantiation of the poll component. By default, the parameter is set to org.onehippo.forge.poll.contentbean.PollDocument. If you create your own document type, including the poll compound type, you will have to write your own content bean, inheriting from org.hippoecm.hst.content.beans.standard.HippoDocumentBean, representing the content of your poll documents, and refer to that class through this parameter.

This parameter specifies the JCR name of the poll compound inside your poll document. It is used to access the core poll data of your poll document, managed by the PollProvider. By default, the parameter is set to poll:poll, which works out of the box for the document type provided by the poll plug-in.

This parameter specifies where the poll data (the votes of the poll) are kept. As keeping this data together with the poll documents is tricky from a security point of view, the poll plug-in, by default, keeps all poll data in a separate root-level folder called /polldata in the repository. We recommend to keep this unchanged, as the creation of a root-level repository folder is not allowed at runtime.
